info.long_name: Mean percentage of 3rd graders passing reading test
info.short_description: Mean percentage of 3rd grade population passing reading test for schools in the region
info.long_description: Mean percentage of 3rd grade population passing reading test. The median is calculated across schools in the region.
info.statement: In most regions, {value} of 3rd graders pass reading in {features.name}.

info.short_description: Population self-reported as employed as a percentage of total civilian workforce population.
info.long_description: Population self-reported as employed as a percentage of total civilian workforce population. Based on American Community Survey Table B23025 ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
info.statement: {value} of the population in {features.name} is employed.

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: Table B23025

info.long_name: Access to day care by capacity
info.short_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations
info.long_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations. Address and capacity data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool.
info.statement: There are {value} daycare seats in {features.name}.

info.long_name: Day care geographic availability (3-step floating catchment area)
info.short_description: Index of day care availability based on supply of and demand for providers
info.long_description: Day care availability based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of day care facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Provider address data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool. The demand for day care services is the population 0-15 years old and the supply is the capacity of day cares (number of seats).
info.statement: The daycare availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Day care availability by median drive time to the five closest day cares in minutes
info.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region
info.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region. Address data were collected from the Virginia Department of Social Services Child Day Care Facility search (Dataset for year 2019). Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2022).
info.statement: The median drive time to the five closest day cares to {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools per 100k people over 14.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

info.short_description: Index of dental care availability based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: Dental care availability based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of dentists per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for dentists (population served by dentists). Provider address data were collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
info.statement: The dental care availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity (a lack of access to enough food for an active, healthy life).
info.long_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity. Food-insecure households are not necessarily food insecure all the time. Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
info.statement: {value} of the population of children in {features.name} are food insecure.

info.short_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food.
info.long_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food, as estimated by the Current Population Survey, divided by 21 (assuming three meals a day, seven days a week). This amount has been adjusted to reflect local food prices and relevant taxes.
info.statement: The average meal cost in {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods.

info.short_description: Health literacy composite captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions
info.long_description: The health literacy composite captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions. Health literacy composite is based on variables of demographic characteristics, health status, and health care use.
info.statement: The health literacy composite for {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people.
info.long_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) hospitals as listed by the U.S. Health and Human Services, with number of beds (overall average of 7 day averages) as supply values, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the total population as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distance between hospital locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} hospital beds per 100k people in {features.name}.

info.long_name: Mental health services access score (3-step  floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of mental health services accessibility based on supply and demand of facilities
info.long_description: Mental health services access score based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a facility is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for facilities (adult population).
info.statement: The mental health services accessibility score for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_description: Count of mental health facilities based on facility locations. Location data was collected from the Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (HIFLD) repository.

info.statement: There are {value} daycare seats in {features.name}.

info.long_name: Day care geographic availability (3-step floating catchment area)
info.short_description: Index of day care availability based on supply of and demand for providers
info.long_description: Day care availability based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of day care facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Provider address data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool. The demand for day care services is the population 0-15 years old and the supply is the capacity of day cares (number of seats).
info.statement: The daycare availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region. Address data were collected from the Virginia Department of Social Services Child Day Care Facility search (Dataset for year 2019). Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2022).
info.statement: The median drive time to the five closest day cares to {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools per 100k people over 14.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: data/5_year_seq_by_state

info.short_description: Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity (a lack of access to enough food for an active, healthy life).
info.long_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity. Food-insecure households are not necessarily food insecure all the time. Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
info.statement: {value} of the population of children in {features.name} are food insecure.

info.short_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food.
info.long_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food, as estimated by the Current Population Survey, divided by 21 (assuming three meals a day, seven days a week). This amount has been adjusted to reflect local food prices and relevant taxes.
info.statement: The average meal cost in {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods.
info.long_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food-insecure households are not necessarily food insecure all the time. Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
info.statement: {value} of the population in {features.name} are food insecure.

info.short_description: Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity (a lack of access to enough food for an active, healthy life).
info.long_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. info.short_description: Health literacy composite captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions
info.long_description: The health literacy composite captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions. Health literacy composite is based on variables of demographic characteristics, health status, and health care use.
info.statement: The health literacy composite for {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people.
info.long_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) hospitals as listed by the U.S. Health and Human Services, with number of beds (overall average of 7 day averages) as supply values, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the total population as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distance between hospital locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} hospital beds per 100k people in {features.name}.

sources.name: U.S. Department of Health & Human Services
sources.location: Hospital > COVID-19 Reported Patient Impact and Hospital Capacity by Facility

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: data/5_year_seq_by_state

info.long_name: Mental health services access by median drive time to the ten closest facilities in minutes
info.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the ten closest mental health services facilities
info.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the ten closest mental health services facilities. Facility location data was collected from the Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (HIFLD) repository. Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2021).
info.statement: The median drive time to the ten closest mental health service facilities to {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Mental health services access score (3-step  floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of mental health services accessibility based on supply and demand of facilities
info.long_description: Mental health services access score based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a facility is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for facilities (adult population).
info.statement: The mental health services accessibility score for {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Count of mental health facilities based on facility locations
info.long_description: Count of mental health facilities based on facility locations. Location data was collected from the Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (HIFLD) repository.
info.statement: There are {value} mental health facilities in {features.name}.

info.long_name: OBGYN care geographic availability (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of OBGYN care availability based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: OBGYN care availability based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of OBGYNs per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for OBGYNs (population served by OBGYNs). Provider address data were collected from WebMD's online physician directory.
info.statement: The OBGYN availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Pediatric care geographic availability (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of pediatric care physician availability based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: Pediatric care availability based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of pediatricians per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for pediatricians (population under 16). Provider address data were collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
info.statement: The pediatric care availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Access to day care by capacity
info.short_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations
info.long_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations. Address and capacity data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool.
info.statement: There are {value} daycare seats in {features.name}.

info.long_name: Day care geographic availability (3-step floating catchment area)
info.short_description: Index of day care availability based on supply of and demand for providers
info.long_description: Day care availability based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of day care facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Provider address data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool. The demand for day care services is the population 0-15 years old and the supply is the capacity of day cares (number of seats).
info.statement: The daycare availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Day care availability by median drive time to the five closest day cares in minutes
info.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region
info.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region. Address data were collected from the Virginia Department of Social Services Child Day Care Facility search (Dataset for year 2019). Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2022).
info.statement: The median drive time to the five closest day cares to {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools per 100k people over 14.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

info.long_name: Dental care geographic availability (2 step-enhanced floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of dental care availability based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: Dental care availability based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of dentists per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for dentists (population served by dentists). Provider address data were collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
info.statement: The dental care availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity (a lack of access to enough food for an active, healthy life).
info.long_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity. Food-insecure households are not necessarily food insecure all the time. Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
info.statement: {value} of the population of children in {features.name} are food insecure.

info.short_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food.
info.long_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food, as estimated by the Current Population Survey, divided by 21 (assuming three meals a day, seven days a week). This amount has been adjusted to reflect local food prices and relevant taxes.
info.statement: The average meal cost in {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods.

Food-insecure households are not necessarily food insecure all the time. Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
info.statement: {value} of the population in {features.name} are food insecure.

info.short_description: Health literacy composite captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions
info.long_description: The health literacy composite captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions. Health literacy composite is based on variables of demographic characteristics, health status, and health care use.
info.statement: The health literacy composite for {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people.
info.long_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) hospitals as listed by the U.S. Health and Human Services, with number of beds (overall average of 7 day averages) as supply values, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the total population as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distance between hospital locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} hospital beds per 100k people in {features.name}.

info.short_description: Index of mental health services accessibility based on supply and demand of facilities
info.long_description: Mental health services access score based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a facility is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for facilities (adult population).

info.short_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations

info.statement: There are {value} daycare seats in {features.name}.

info.long_name: Day care geographic availability (3-step floating catchment area)
info.short_description: Index of day care availability based on supply of and demand for providers
info.long_description: Day care availability based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of day care facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Provider address data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool. The demand for day care services is the population 0-15 years old and the supply is the capacity of day cares (number of seats).
info.statement: The daycare availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Day care availability by median drive time to the five closest day cares in minutes
info.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region
info.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region. Address data were collected from the Virginia Department of Social Services Child Day Care Facility search (Dataset for year 2019). Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2022).
info.statement: The median drive time to the five closest day cares to {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools per 100k people over 14.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: data/5_year_seq_by_state

info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools with science programs per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or less than 2-year or longer certificates with science programs (any with Classification of Institutional Programs [CIP] codes starting with 41) per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools with any degrees conferred in the given year with a CIP code starting with 41, as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools with a science program per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics and Completions files

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: data/5_year_seq_by_state

info.long_name: Dental care geographic availability (2 step-enhanced floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of dental care availability based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: Dental care availability based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of dentists per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for dentists (population served by dentists). Provider address data were collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
info.statement: The dental care availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity (a lack of access to enough food for an active, healthy life).
info.long_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity. Food-insecure households are not necessarily food insecure all the time. Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
info.statement: {value} of the population of children in {features.name} are food insecure.

info.short_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food.
info.long_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food, as estimated by the Current Population Survey, divided by 21 (assuming three meals a day, seven days a week). This amount has been adjusted to reflect local food prices and relevant taxes.
info.statement: The average meal cost in {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods.
info.long_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food-insecure households are not necessarily food insecure all the time. Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
info.statement: {value} of the population in {features.name} are food insecure.

info.short_description: Health literacy composite captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions
info.long_description: The health literacy composite captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions. Health literacy composite is based on variables of demographic characteristics, health status, and health care use.
info.statement: The health literacy composite for {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people.
info.long_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) hospitals as listed by the U.S. Health and Human Services, with number of beds (overall average of 7 day averages) as supply values, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the total population as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distance between hospital locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} hospital beds per 100k people in {features.name}.

sources.location: Hospital > COVID-19 Reported Patient Impact and Hospital Capacity by Facility

info.long_description: Substance use/behavioral health services access score based on 3-step  floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a facility is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for facilities (adult population).
info.statement: The substance use/behavioral health services accessibility score for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Access to day care by capacity
info.short_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations
info.long_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations. Address and capacity data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool.
info.statement: There are {value} daycare seats in {features.name}.

info.long_name: Day care geographic availability (3-step floating catchment area)
info.short_description: Index of day care availability based on supply of and demand for providers
info.long_description: Day care availability based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of day care facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Provider address data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool. The demand for day care services is the population 0-15 years old and the supply is the capacity of day cares (number of seats).
info.statement: The daycare availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Day care availability by median drive time to the five closest day cares in minutes
info.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region
info.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region. Address data were collected from the Virginia Department of Social Services Child Day Care Facility search (Dataset for year 2019). Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2022).
info.statement: The median drive time to the five closest day cares to {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools per 100k people over 14.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: data/5_year_seq_by_state

info.short_description: Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity (a lack of access to enough food for an active, healthy life).
info.long_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity. Food-insecure households are not necessarily food insecure all the time. Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
info.statement: {value} of the population of children in {features.name} are food insecure.

info.short_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food.
info.long_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food, as estimated by the Current Population Survey, divided by 21 (assuming three meals a day, seven days a week). This amount has been adjusted to reflect local food prices and relevant taxes.
info.statement: The average meal cost in {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods.

Food-insecure households are not necessarily food insecure all the time. Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
info.statement: {value} of the population in {features.name} are food insecure.

info.short_description: Health literacy composite captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions
info.long_description: The health literacy composite captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions. Health literacy composite is based on variables of demographic characteristics, health status, and health care use.
info.statement: The health literacy composite for {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people.
info.long_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) hospitals as listed by the U.S. Health and Human Services, with number of beds (overall average of 7 day averages) as supply values, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the total population as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distance between hospital locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} hospital beds per 100k people in {features.name}.

sources.location: Hospital > COVID-19 Reported Patient Impact and Hospital Capacity by Facility

info.short_description: Index of mental health services accessibility based on supply and demand of facilities
info.long_description: Mental health services access score based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a facility is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for facilities (adult population).

info.statement: There are {value} daycare seats in {features.name}.

info.long_name: Day care geographic availability (3-step floating catchment area)
info.short_description: Index of day care availability based on supply of and demand for providers
info.long_description: Day care availability based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of day care facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Provider address data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool. The demand for day care services is the population 0-15 years old and the supply is the capacity of day cares (number of seats).
info.statement: The daycare availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Day care availability by median drive time to the five closest day cares in minutes
info.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region
info.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region. Address data were collected from the Virginia Department of Social Services Child Day Care Facility search (Dataset for year 2019). Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2022).
info.statement: The median drive time to the five closest day cares to {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools per 100k people over 14.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: data/5_year_seq_by_state

School locations are from the National Center for Education Statistics. All distances are calculated at the block group level, then averaged up to higher-level geographies.

info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools with computer science programs per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or less than 2-year or longer certificates with computer science programs (any with Classification of Institutional Programs [CIP] codes starting with 11) per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools with any degrees conferred in the given year with a CIP code starting with 11, as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools with a computer science program per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics and Completions files

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: data/5_year_seq_by_state

info.long_name: Dental care geographic availability (2 step-enhanced floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of dental care availability based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: Dental care availability based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of dentists per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for dentists (population served by dentists). Provider address data were collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
info.statement: The dental care availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity (a lack of access to enough food for an active, healthy life).
info.long_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity. Food-insecure households are not necessarily food insecure all the time. Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
info.statement: {value} of the population of children in {features.name} are food insecure.

info.short_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food.
info.long_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food, as estimated by the Current Population Survey, divided by 21 (assuming three meals a day, seven days a week). This amount has been adjusted to reflect local food prices and relevant taxes.
info.statement: The average meal cost in {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Health literacy composite captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions
info.long_description: The health literacy composite captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions. Health literacy composite is based on variables of demographic characteristics, health status, and health care use.
info.statement: The health literacy composite for {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people.
info.long_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) hospitals as listed by the U.S. Health and Human Services, with number of beds (overall average of 7 day averages) as supply values, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the total population as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distance between hospital locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} hospital beds per 100k people in {features.name}.

info.long_name: Preventable hospital stays per 100,000 Medicare enrollees

info.long_description: Rate of hospital stays for ambulatory-care sensitive conditions per 100,000 Medicare enrollees. Ambulatory care refers to diagnoses that are usually treatable in outpatient settings. Data are based on Medicare claims and come from County Health Rankings.
info.statement: {value} of the hospitalizations in {features.name} were preventable (due to conditions usually treated in outpatient settings).

info.long_name: Primary care geographic availability (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of primary care physician availability based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: Primary care availability based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of physicians per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for physicians (population served by physicians). Provider address data were collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
info.statement: The primary care availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Access to day care by capacity
info.short_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations
info.long_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations. Address and capacity data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool.
info.statement: There are {value} daycare seats in {features.name}.

info.long_name: Day care geographic availability (3-step floating catchment area)
info.short_description: Index of day care availability based on supply of and demand for providers
info.long_description: Day care availability based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of day care facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Provider address data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool. The demand for day care services is the population 0-15 years old and the supply is the capacity of day cares (number of seats).
info.statement: The daycare availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Day care availability by median drive time to the five closest day cares in minutes
info.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region
info.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region. Address data were collected from the Virginia Department of Social Services Child Day Care Facility search (Dataset for year 2019). Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2022).
info.statement: The median drive time to the five closest day cares to {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools per 100k people over 14.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: data/5_year_seq_by_state

info.short_description: Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity (a lack of access to enough food for an active, healthy life).
info.long_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity. Food-insecure households are not necessarily food insecure all the time. Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
info.statement: {value} of the population of children in {features.name} are food insecure.

info.short_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food.
info.long_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food, as estimated by the Current Population Survey, divided by 21 (assuming three meals a day, seven days a week). This amount has been adjusted to reflect local food prices and relevant taxes.
info.statement: The average meal cost in {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods.

Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
info.statement: {value} of the population in {features.name} are food insecure.

info.long_description: The health literacy composite captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions. Health literacy composite is based on variables of demographic characteristics, health status, and health care use.
info.statement: The health literacy composite for {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people.
info.long_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) hospitals as listed by the U.S. Health and Human Services, with number of beds (overall average of 7 day averages) as supply values, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the total population as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distance between hospital locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} hospital beds per 100k people in {features.name}.

info.long_description: Minimal drive time to a hospital with intensive care unit beds from the Census block group centroid, as calculated by the Open Source Routing Machine in 2022. info.long_name: Mental health services access by median drive time to the ten closest facilities in minutes
info.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the ten closest mental health services facilities
info.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the ten closest mental health services facilities. Facility location data was collected from the Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (HIFLD) repository. Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2021).
info.statement: The median drive time to the ten closest mental health service facilities to {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Mental health services access score (3-step  floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of mental health services accessibility based on supply and demand of facilities
info.long_description: Mental health services access score based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a facility is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for facilities (adult population).
info.statement: The mental health services accessibility score for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Access to mental health services by count
info.short_description: Count of mental health facilities based on facility locations
info.long_description: Count of mental health facilities based on facility locations. Location data was collected from the Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (HIFLD) repository.
info.statement: There are {value} mental health facilities in {features.name}.

info.short_description: The number of available healthy and less healthy food retailers. A higher score indicates more available healthy options per less healthy options. A score of 0 indicates available no options (food desert).
info.statement: The Retail food environment index is {value} in {features.name}.

info.long_description: Percentage of the population self-reported to be currently covered by any type of health insurance or health coverage plan. Based on American Community Survey Table B27010 in ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
info.statement: {value} of the population has health insurance in {features.name}.

info.long_name: OBGYN care geographic availability (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of OBGYN care availability based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: OBGYN care availability based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of OBGYNs per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for OBGYNs (population served by OBGYNs). Provider address data were collected from WebMD's online physician directory.
info.statement: The OBGYN availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Pediatric care geographic availability (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of pediatric care physician availability based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: Pediatric care availability based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of pediatricians per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for pediatricians (population under 16). Provider address data were collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
info.statement: The pediatric care availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Access to day care by capacity
info.short_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations
info.long_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations. Address and capacity data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool.
info.statement: There are {value} daycare seats in {features.name}.

info.long_name: Day care geographic availability (3-step floating catchment area)
info.short_description: Index of day care availability based on supply of and demand for providers
info.long_description: Day care availability based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of day care facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Provider address data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool. The demand for day care services is the population 0-15 years old and the supply is the capacity of day cares (number of seats).
info.statement: The daycare availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Day care availability by median drive time to the five closest day cares in minutes
info.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region
info.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region. Address data were collected from the Virginia Department of Social Services Child Day Care Facility search (Dataset for year 2019). Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2022).
info.statement: The median drive time to the five closest day cares to {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Number of 2-year schools per 100k people over 14.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

sources.name: American Community Survey
sources.location: data/5_year_seq_by_state

info.short_description: Drive time to the nearest 2-year schools.
info.long_description: Minimal drive time to a school authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates from the Census block group centroid, as calculated by the Open Source Routing Machine in 2022. School locations are from the National Center for Education Statistics. All distances are calculated at the block group level, then averaged up to higher-level geographies.
info.statement: It takes {value} to drive to a 2-year school from {features.name}'s block group centroids on average.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

info.short_description: Number of <2-year schools per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
info.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award certificates that are typically obtained in less than 2 years per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) <2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} <2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

info.long_name: Dental care geographic availability (2 step-enhanced floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of dental care availability based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: Dental care availability based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of dentists per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for dentists (population served by dentists). Provider address data were collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
info.statement: The dental care availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity (a lack of access to enough food for an active, healthy life).
info.long_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food insecure children are those children living in households experiencing food insecurity. Food-insecure households are not necessarily food insecure all the time. Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
info.statement: {value} of the population of children in {features.name} are food insecure.

info.short_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food.
info.long_description: The average weekly dollar amount food-secure individuals report spending on food, as estimated by the Current Population Survey, divided by 21 (assuming three meals a day, seven days a week). This amount has been adjusted to reflect local food prices and relevant taxes.
info.statement: The average meal cost in {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_description: The health literacy composite captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions. Health literacy composite is based on variables of demographic characteristics, health status, and health care use.
info.statement: The health literacy composite for {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people.
info.long_description: Number of hospital beds per 100k people, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) hospitals as listed by the U.S. Health and Human Services, with number of beds (overall average of 7 day averages) as supply values, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the total population as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distance between hospital locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
info.statement: There are {value} hospital beds per 100k people in {features.name}.

info.short_description: Index of OBGYN care availability based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: OBGYN care availability based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of OBGYNs per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for OBGYNs (population served by OBGYNs). Provider address data were collected from WebMD's online physician directory.
info.statement: The OBGYN availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Pediatric care geographic availability (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of pediatric care physician availability based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: Pediatric care availability based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of pediatricians per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for pediatricians (population under 16). Provider address data were collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
info.statement: The pediatric care availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_description: The national average price for internet ($64) as a percentage of median household income.

info.short_description: Percent of the total population with a good internet speed (above 25/3 MB/s, able to stream video or online game for one device).
info.statement: {value} of the total population in {features.name} has a good internet speed.

info.long_name: Percent of the Internet-Connected Population with Fast Internet Speed
info.short_description: Percent of the internet-connected population with a fast internet speed (above 100/20 MB/s, able to stream HD video on multiple devices or download large files quickly).
info.statement: {value} of the internet-connected population in {features.name} has a fast internet speed.

info.long_name: Percent of the Internet-Connected Population with Good Internet Speed
info.short_description: Percent of the internet-connected population with a good internet speed (above 25/3 MB/s, able to stream video or online game for one device).
info.statement: {value} of the internet-connected population in {features.name} has a good internet speed.

info.long_description: Percent of the population self-reporting poor mental health in over 14 days of the previous month. Based on the Virginia Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance Survey.
info.statement: {value} of the population in {features.name} reports poor mental health.

info.long_description: Percentage of the population self-reported to have post-secondary education. Based on American Community Survey Table B15003 in ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
info.statement: {value} of the population in {features.name} has a post-secondary education.

info.long_name: Preventable hospital stays per 100,000 Medicare enrollees
info.short_description: Rate of hospital stays for ambulatory-care sensitive conditions per 100,000 Medicare enrollees
info.long_description: Rate of hospital stays for ambulatory-care sensitive conditions per 100,000 Medicare enrollees. Ambulatory care refers to diagnoses that are usually treatable in outpatient settings. Data are based on Medicare claims and come from County Health Rankings.
info.statement: {value} of the hospitalizations in {features.name} were preventable (due to conditions usually treated in outpatient settings).

info.long_name: Primary care geographic availability (2-step enhanced floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of primary care physician availability based on supply and demand of providers
info.long_description: Primary care availability based on 2-step enhanced floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of physicians per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for physicians (population served by physicians). Provider address data were collected from WebMD's online Physician Directory.
info.statement: The primary care availability for {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_description: Average download speed weighted by number of devices.
info.statement: The average download speed is {value} in {features.name}.

info.short_description: Average upload speed weighted by number of devices.
info.statement: The average upload speed is {value} in {features.name}.

info.short_description: The number of unique devices accessing Ookla Internet speed tests.

info.short_name: Substance use/behavioral health services access (drive time)
info.long_name: Substance use/behavioral health services access by median drive time to the ten closest facilities in minutes
info.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the ten closest substance use/behavioral health services facilities
info.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the ten closest substance use/behavioral health services facilities. Facility location data was collected from the Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (HIFLD) repository. Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2021).
info.statement: The median drive time to the ten closest substance use/behavioral health service facilities to {features.name} is {value}.

info.short_name: Substance use/behavioral health services access score
info.long_name: Substance use/behavioral health services access score (3-step floating catchment areas)
info.short_description: Index of substance use/behavioral health services accessibility based on supply and demand of facilities
info.long_description: Substance use/behavioral health services access score based on 3-step  floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a facility is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for facilities (adult population).
info.statement: The substance use/behavioral health services accessibility score for {features.name} is {value}.

info.long_name: Access to substance use/behavioral health  by count
info.short_description: Count of substance use/behavioral health facilities based on facility locations
info.long_description: Count of substance use/behavioral health facilities based on facility locations. Location data was collected from the Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (HIFLD) repository.
info.statement: There are {value} substance use facilities in {features.name}.
